name: dimensional
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
approving having many different features or qualities, especially in a way that makes something seem real; not too simple: I would say all the characters are strong, dimensional, fully-imagined women.
having or appearing to have height, length, and width; not flat: The recycling facility uses mechanical equipment to separate dimensional items - cans, plastic and juice or milk boxes - from flat paper items. Synonym
three-dimensional
relating to the dimensions (= measurements such as height, length, or width) of something: The project was a challenge because of the dimensional limitations of the space.
More examplesFewer examplesThe new version of the game is a much more immersive, dimensional and original experience than the original.Even this great actress struggles to make her character dimensional and to bring such a poor script to life. The coffee has rich, dimensional flavours of hazelnut and dried fruits.A variety of line patterns can be used to suggest dimensional shadows.His early animations were basically just dimensional line drawings on the screen.

-dimensional suffix
(MEASUREMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
having measurements in one or more different directions, esp. height, length, or width: a three-dimensional figure
-dimensional suffix
(QUALITY)
(of a thing or situation) having one or more parts or qualities that have an effect on the way you think about it: a multi-dimensional problem
Add to word list
Add to word list
having a particular number of dimensions (= measurements or features): a three-dimensional figure The response to future crises needs to be multi-dimensional.
